frameDefinitions: In this frame a State_of_affairs is prohibited (or allowed) by a Principle.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items.
An Item is in a state of dryness.
An Agent has committed a Wrong in the past and is making Amends for it.
An Experiencer is in a State where a biological urge is signaling the need to perform a certain action such as eating, drinking, stopping exertion, sleeping, regurgitating, or having sex.
frameExamples: Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
The players <t>emptied</t> the bucket over his head.
He <t>atoned</t> for his sin with good works.
listRoleDefinitions: A moral, legal, or social norm which rules a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> to be inadmissible behavior or an outcome of behavior.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the prohibiting occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the prohibiting occurs.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that does the emptying.
The <fen>Theme</fen>, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by 'of'.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the region or container which is emptied of something.  In this frame, the <fen>Source</fen> occurs as an NP Object.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying.
The time at which the emptying takes place.
The location where the emptying takes place.
The <fen>Item</fen> exists in a state of dryness.
The <fen>Agent</fen> has committed a <fen>Wrong</fen> and is making <fen>Amends</fen>.
<fen>Wrong</fen> identifies the act committed by the <fen>Agent</fen> for which <fen>Amends</fen> are made.
<fen>Amends</fen> marks expressions that indicate what the <fen>Agent</fen> does to compensate for the <fen>Wrong</fen> that was committed.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> atones for the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> expiates the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> receives the biological signal and possesses the internal experience which is a reaction to the phsyical signal.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is used for a gesture, expression, or body part indicating that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is feeling a certain urge.
<fen>State</fen> identifies the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s state of being.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the biological signal. <fen>Time</fen> may also allow inference about the <fen>Reason</fen> for the biological urge.
This role identifies the  <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the biological signal.
listRoleExamples:
<fex>The Establishment Clause of the First Amendment</fex> plainly prohibits the
establishment of a national religion by Congress.
There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
<fex>A basic washing</fex> can degrease your workclothes.
The prisoners were deloused <fex>in June and August</fex>.
<fex>Syria</fex> has atoned for its support of Iraq.
Smithers is atoning <fex>for his misspent youth</fex>.
He atoned for his sin <fex>with good works</fex>.
He gave me a tired <fex>shrug</fex> and then looked down again.
She was alarmed by John's hungry <fex>state</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the better part of a year
the Brazilian Coalition on Climate, Forests, and Agriculture
